Name: Application to Transfer a Premises Licence PDF
Output_template:
{"name":"Application to Transfer a Premises Licence PDF","remove_margins":"","setPaperType":"a4","content":"

Reference: {case_id} | PDF Created: {current_datetime_h}

Application to Transfer a Premises Licence to be granted under the Licensing Act 2003

Please note: You must provide online payment to transfer this licence after completing the form. After clicking the submit button at the end of the form you will be taken to our secure online payment website. You can then make the required payment using either a credit or a debit card.
Cost of Application: £{paymentCost}
I/We, {nameOfTheApplicant}
apply to transfer the premises licence described below under section 42 of the Licensing Act 2003 for the premises described in Part 1 below.
Premises Licence Number: {premisesLicenceNum}

Part 1 - Premises Details

Premises Address
Flat number (if any) {address/flatNumber}
House number / name {address/houseNumber}
Road name {address/streetName}
Town {address/townName}
County {address/countyName}
Post Code {address/postcodeOther}
Daytime contact telephone number (if any): {contactTelephone}
Premises email address (optional): {premisesEmail/emailAddress}
Please give a brief description of the premises:
{#premisesDescription}
Name of the current Premises Licence holder: {licenceHolder}
In what capacity are you applying to transfer the premises licence to you?: {applyingAs}
I am: {iAm}

Individual Applicants

Title: {titleA}

First name(s): {firstNamesA}

Surname: {surnameA}

Date of Birth: {DOBA}

I am 18 years old or older: {confirm18A}

Nationality: {nationalityA}

Where applicable (if demonstrating a right to work via the Home Office online right to work checking service), the 9-digit ‘share code’ provided to the applicant by that service (please see note 2 for information): {shareCodeA}

Flat number (if any) {addressSubA/flatNumber}
House number / name {addressSubA/houseNumber}
Road name {addressSubA/streetName}
Town {addressSubA/townName}
County {addressSubA/countyName}
Post Code {addressSubA/postcodeOther}
Daytime contact telephone number: {individualContactA}
Applicant email address (optional): {applicantEmailSub/emailAddress}

Second Individual Applicant (if applicable)

Title: {titleA2}

First name(s): {firstNamesA2}

Surname: {surnameA2}

Date of Birth: {DOBA2}

I am 18 years old or older: {confirm18A2}

Nationality: {nationalityA2}

Where applicable (if demonstrating a right to work via the Home Office online right to work checking service), the 9-digit ‘share code’ provided to the applicant by that service (please see note 2 for information): {shareCodeA2}

Applicant Address
Flat number (if any) {addressSubA2/flatNumber}
House number / name {addressSubA2/houseNumber}
Road name {addressSubA2/streetName}
Town {addressSubA2/townName}
County {addressSubA2/countyName}
Post Code {addressSubA2/postcodeOther}
Daytime contact telephone number: {individualContactA2}
Applicant email address (optional): {individualApplicantEmailSub1/emailAddress}

Other Applicants

Please provide name and registered address of the applicant in full. Where appropriate, please give any registered number.
In the case of a partnership or other joint venture (other than a body corporate), please give the name and address of each party concerned.
@af:repeat({otherApplicant})

Name: {otherApplicant/name}

Flat number (if any) {otherApplicant/flatNumber}
House number / name {otherApplicant/houseNumber}
Road name {otherApplicant/streetName}
Town {otherApplicant/townName}
County {otherApplicant/countyName}
Post Code {otherApplicant/postcodeOther}

Registered number: {otherApplicant/registeredNumber}

Description of Applicant: {otherApplicant/description}

Telephone: {otherApplicant/telephoneNumber}

Email: {otherApplicant/emailAddress}

@endaf:repeat

Part 2

Are you the holder of the premises licence under an interim authority notice?: {licenceUnderAuthority}
Do you wish to transfer with immediate effect?: {transferImmediate}
If not, when would you like the transfer to take effect?: {transferDate}

In order to transfer a premises licence, the existing premises licence holder must complete a consent form. This is available on our website as a separate online form.

Alternatively, the consent form is available as a pdf, which can be sent to: Licensing, Brentwood Borough Council, Town Hall, Ingrave Road, Brentwood, Essex CM15 8AY. Please include the reference number for this form, which will be produced when you submit it.

Are you able to submit a copy of the consent form?: {submitCopy}
If you have not submitted the consent form, please give reasons why not. What steps have you taken to try to obtain the consent?:
{#reasonsWhyNot}
If this application is granted, I would be in a position to use the premises during the application period for the licensable activity or activities authorised by the licence (see section 43 of the Licensing Act 2003): {usePremisesDuring}
Are you able to submit a copy of the premises licence?: {submitCopy2}
Please send the premises licence to: Licensing, Brentwood Borough Council, Town Hall, Ingrave Road, Brentwood, Essex CM15 8AY. Please include the reference number for this form, which will be produced when you submit it.
If you are not able to submit the premises licence, please give the reasons why not:
{#reasonsWhyNot2}

Declaration

I will submit a consent form (available as a separate online form or as a paper form on our website) completed by the existing premises licence holder or my statement as to why it is not available: {agreeSubmit}
I have uploaded the premises licence or relevant part of it or explanation: {agreeUpload}
The Licensing Authority will send a copy of this application to the chief officer of police today: {agreeSendCopy}
The Licensing Authority will send a copy of this form to Home Office Immigration Enforcement today: {agreeSendCopyHome}
I understand that if I do not comply with the above requirements my application will be rejected: {agreeUnderstand}

(Applicable to all individual applicants, including those in a partnership which is not a limited liability partnership, but not companies or limited liability partnerships) I have included documents, or my Home Office online right to work checking service share code, to demonstrate my entitlement to work in the United Kingdom (please read note 2): {declare1}

IT IS AN OFFENCE, UNDER SECTION 158 OF THE LICENSING ACT 2003, TO MAKE A FALSE STATEMENT IN OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS APPLICATION. THOSE WHO MAKE A FALSE STATEMENT MAY BE LIABLE ON SUMMARY CONVICTION TO A FINE OF ANY AMOUNT.

IT IS AN OFFENCE UNDER SECTION 24B OF THE IMMIGRATION ACT 1971 FOR A PERSON TO WORK WHEN THEY KNOW, OR HAVE REASONABLE CAUSE TO BELIEVE, THAT THEY ARE DISQUALIFIED FROM DOING SO BY REASON OF THEIR IMMIGRATION STATUS. THOSE WHO EMPLOY AN ADULT WITHOUT LEAVE OR WHO IS SUBJECT TO CONDITIONS AS TO EMPLOYMENT WILL BE LIABLE TO A CIVIL PENALTY UNDER SECTION 15 OF THE IMMIGRATION, ASYLUM AND NATIONALITY ACT 2006 AND, PURSUANT TO SECTION 21 OF THE SAME ACT, WILL BE COMMITTING AN OFFENCE WHERE THEY DO SO IN THE KNOWLEDGE, OR WITH REASONABLE CAUSE TO BELIEVE, THAT THE EMPLOYEE IS DISQUALIFIED.

I understand I am not entitled to be issued with a licence if I do not have the entitlement to live and work in the UK (or if I am subject to a condition preventing me from doing work relating to the carrying on of a licensable activity) and that my licence will become invalid if I cease to be entitled to live and work in the UK (please read guidance note 2)

Part 3 - Signatures (please read guidance note 3)

Date: {signatureDate}
Capacity: {signatureCapacity}

Signature: {signaturePrintName2}
Date: {signatureDate2}

Contact name (where not previously given) and postal address for correspondence associated with this application (please read guidance note 6)
